posts.title: Welcome to My Creative Journey
posts.excerpt: Hello and welcome! I'm Gary, and this is where I'll be sharing my thoughts on design, creativity, and the projects I'm working on.
posts.content:
Hello and welcome to my blog! I'm Gary, a passionate designer and creative professional, and I'm excited to share my journey with you.

This space will be dedicated to exploring the intersection of art, design, and technology. I'll be sharing insights from my projects, tutorials, behind-the-scenes looks at my creative process, and thoughts on the ever-evolving world of digital design.

Whether you're a fellow designer, a student, or just someone who appreciates creativity, I hope you'll find something valuable here. Stay tuned for more content coming soon!

posts.title: Stream Bud: A Complete Brand Identity Case Study
posts.excerpt: Dive deep into the creative process behind Stream Bud, a comprehensive brand identity project that includes everything from logo design to merchandise mockups.
posts.content:
The Stream Bud project was one of my most comprehensive branding endeavors. What started as a simple logo design evolved into a full brand identity system.

The Challenge

Create a cohesive brand identity for a streaming-focused platform that would appeal to content creators and their audiences.

The Solution

I developed a complete brand system including:

  • Logo variations (1-color, 2-color, 3-color)
  • Letterhead and stationery
  • Business cards and envelopes
  • Merchandise mockups (hoodies, phone cases, controllers)
  • YouTube channel branding
  • Website design

The result is a versatile brand that works across all platforms and applications.
posts.author: Gary

posts.title: The Power of Sketching: 90 Designs Later
posts.excerpt: Why I believe sketching is still the most powerful tool in a designer's arsenal, even in the age of digital tools.
posts.content:
In a world dominated by digital tools, there's something magical about putting pen to paper. My 90 sketches project taught me invaluable lessons about the design process.

Why Sketch?

Sketching allows for rapid ideation without the constraints of software. It's faster, more intuitive, and often leads to more creative solutions.

What I Learned

After completing 90 sketches, I discovered that the best ideas often come after the first 20-30 attempts. Persistence and volume lead to innovation.

Don't be afraid to fill pages with 'bad' ideas â€“ they often lead to the best ones.
